recipe.name: Leftover Mashed Potato Cheese & Bacon Cakes
recipe.description: This might be called "Leftover Mashed Potato" cakes but most of the time, I will make mashed potatoes especially to make these! Great for breakfast, lunch OR dinner! I made these with bacon but they're also lovely with canned tuna (drained of oil) or even diced cooked chicken or any other protein.
recipeIngredient: 2 cups panko breadcrumbs OR 3/4 cup plain flour

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together the Potato Cake ingredients in a bowl until just combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix together the Potato Cake ingredients in a bowl until just combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread the panko or flour out on a large plate or baking tray (to fit 6 patties).
recipeInstructions.name: Spread the panko or flour out on a large plate or baking tray (to fit 6 patties).

recipeInstructions.text: Measure out 1/4 cup level amount of potato mixture OR a slightly heaped ice cream scooper (this is what I use because using the lever, it pops out easily) and drop onto panko/flour. Repeat to fill plate / baking tray (don't crowd, difficult to handle).
recipeInstructions.name: Measure out 1/4 cup level amount of potato mixture OR a slightly heaped ice cream scooper (this is what I use because using the lever, it pops out easily) and drop onto panko/flour. Repeat to fill plate / baking tray (don't crowd, difficult to handle).

recipeInstructions.text: Use an egg flip (or base of cup) to pat it down to 1.5cm/2/3" thick patties, then flip and pat to coat the other side with panko/flour. Set aside and repeat with remaining potato mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Use an egg flip (or base of cup) to pat it down to 1.5cm/2/3" thick patties, then flip and pat to coat the other side with panko/flour. Set aside and repeat with remaining potato mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1/2 the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Cook 6 patties at a time until golden brown on each side - around 2 minutes, then flip and cook the other side.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 1/2 the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Cook 6 patties at a time until golden brown on each side - around 2 minutes, then flip and cook the other side.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove onto a paper towel lined baking tray. Cook remaining patties.

review.reviewBody: Only had about a cup of leftover mash, which made 6 patties, but they were all enjoyed!  Nice for Sunday lunch.
Absolutely superb.  Easy to make.   The taste is out of this world.   Will definitely be making these on a regular basis

Had leftover potato & sweet potato mash (deliberately!) Husband said this was the best I've ever made. I said 'Nagi recipe'. After eating he said 'Well she might have created the recipe but you made this food, bloody awesome!' Got to love that staunch loyalty xx

These are so tasty!  I admit because I only had 1 cup of mashed potato and 1.5 cups of a mix of mashed potato/cauliflower/brocolli the mixture was a bit too "wet", but it used up my leftovers.  The first ones fell apart in the pan (but tasted great).  I formed the rest and put into the fridge overnight and they held shape the next day.   They were so good I will cook mashed potato to make them 100% to the recipe.  Great comfort food!

I've been cooking potato cakes for years and years as a go to comfort food.  Today I remembered that mine often fall apart and thought I'd search for a recipe.  Your recipe is fabulous.  I don't know if it is cooling the potato (never done that before) the cheese (never added that before) or the egg (which I often skip) but they held together and taste fantastic.  Thank you so much for the time you put into perfecting a recipe so we can enjoy the benefits.
These are beyond delicious.  I fixed them with leftover mashed potatoes and served them with steak.  Had one leftover and ate it with an egg for breakfast.  Really, really good!
Wow, wow, wow! How often is something you made with left overs 10 times better than the "original". My husband loves mashed potatoes, these potato pancakes were even better! Thanks Nagi
Kids absolutely loved them.  So did I - made 16 of them and all gone between 4 in one sittingüòÇ
